M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFCUtils.title: ExporterIFCUtils.IsCurveLoopConvexWithOpenings Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFCUtils.desc: Checks if the region bounded by the input curve loop can be represented as the subtraction of 0 or more convex polygons from a base convex polygon.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFCUtils.remarks: This function is intended to be used to determine if the geometry of a wall with an elevation profile can be successfully represented as a vertical extrusion with one or more openings removed. If this function is to return true, the subtracting polygons must each have at least one edge coincident with the base convex polygon. Before the check is performed, this input curve will be trimmed by the range extents of the wall, if any.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFCUtils.title: ExporterIFCUtils.GetLoopsFromTopBottomFace Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFCUtils.desc: Gets the curve loop(s) that represent the bottom or top face of the wall, usable to create an extrusion for the wall geometry.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFCUtils.remarks: This function is intended to help determine if a Revit Wall can be exported as an IfcWallStandardCase. The conditions for exporting an IfcWallStandardCase require that the geometry of the wall be described as one profile curve loop extruded in the Z direction, with potential clip planes and openings applied to the base geometry. This function will use either the top or bottom face to determine the boundary curve loop. Regardless of whether the top or bottom face is used, the curve loop will be located on the plane corresponding to the base of the wall.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCLinkDocumentE.remarks: Linked documents can only be exported within a transaction, but it is illegal to start a transaction for a linked document. This gives a special exception that does the work necessary to make sure that the host documents do not end up in unstable states after the export. This is not guaranteed for any other workflow. To ensure that the lifetime of the object is correctly managed, you should declare an instance of this class as a part of a 'using' statement in C# or similar construct in other lanuguages.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCTransaction.title: IFCTransaction Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCTransaction.desc: IFC transactions are context-like objects that guard any changes made to an IFC file.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCTransaction.remarks: Any change to an IFC file can only be made while there is an active transaction open for that file. Changes do not become a part of the file until the active transaction is committed. Consequently, all changes made in a transaction can be rolled back either explicitly or implicitly (by the destructor).

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCTransformSett.title: IFCTransformSetter Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCTransformSett.desc: A state-based class that forces an extra transformation applied to objects being exported.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCTransformSett.remarks: IFC has a system of local placements; these are created from a set of transforms in Revit. Sometimes there is a need to create a 'fake' transform to get the right local placement structure for IFC. This class is intended to maintain the transformation for the duration that it is needed. To ensure that the lifetime of the object is correctly managed, you should declare an instance of this class as a part of a 'using' statement in C# or similar construct in other lanuguages.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCImportOptions.title: IFCImportOptions.AutocorrectOffAxisLines Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCImportOptions.desc: Enable or disable correcting lines that are slight off-axis.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCImportOptions.remarks: Enabling correcting lines that are slightly off-axis will snap lines that are close to axes to the nearest axis. This will reduce warnings in Revit, but may cause elements that are created from sketches to slightly change shape, and extrusions to slightly change directions. T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFC.desc: The main class provided by Revit to allow implementation of IFC export.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFC.remarks: An instance of this class is provided to clients which implement IExporterIFC in order to provide an implementation for IFC export. M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFCUtils.title: ExporterIFCUtils.CreateSubElementGUID Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.ExporterIFCUtils.desc:
Creates a consistent GUID for an IFC entity related to a Revit element.
   A "related" sub-element is one that is unique for a given type of element, and can
   therefore by identified by a simple index value (e.g. PSet_Wall_Common property set for a wall.)
   The index value 0 is reserved, as this would generate the GUID of the element itself.
   A listing of known sub-elements is contained in IFCSubElementEnums.cs; it is
   expected that this list would be maintained up-to-date, instead of passing arbitrary values
   into this function.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCImportOptions.title: IFCImportOptions.ForceImport Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCImportOptions.desc: Force the IFC file to be imported regardless of an existing corresponding Revit file.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC.IFCImportOptions.remarks: If this value is true (default), we will perform the import even if the existing corresponding Revit file is up-to-date. If this value is false, then we will re-use an existing RVT file if it is up-to-date. The intention is for ForceImport to be false during host file open while reloading links, and true during link reload via the Manage Links API.
